info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 13 at 2:58PM CDT until May 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN ST. LOUIS COUNTIES AND ST. LOUIS CITY... At 257 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Valley Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 255 PM CDT, ping pong ball size hail was reported near Valley Park. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... St. Louis, Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Kirkwood, Webster Groves, Arnold, Manchester, Creve Coeur, Clayton, Cahokia, Crestwood, Town and Country, Eureka, Ellisville, Richmond Heights, Ladue, Sunset Hills, and Des Peres. This also includes Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, and Castlewood State Park. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 266 and 277. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
